intro: Kanahia kannah, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Kanahia kannah thrives in coastal areas and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays an important role in the ecological and cultural heritage of Hawaii.
